description: Absolutely loved the Chicken Tikka Masala! Best I've had in town.
The ambiance is perfect for dining out. The Lamb Vindaloo was a bit spicy but delicious.
Service was a bit slow, but the food was worth the wait. Enjoyed the Naan Bread.
Kung Pao Chicken was fantastic! Will definitely return!
Great service and the Beef and Broccoli was cooked to perfection.
Decent food but the Sweet and Sour Pork was too sweet for my taste.
Loved the Classic Cheeseburger, juicy and flavorful!
Great atmosphere and delicious Bacon Burger. A must-try!
Veggie Burger was the best I've had! Great options for vegetarians.
Shrimp Tacos are amazing! Fresh ingredients and packed with flavor.
A lively place with an authentic Mexican vibe. Loved the Chorizo Quesadilla.
The food is good, but the service could be faster. Fish Tacos were worth the wait though.
The Chicken Korma is out of this world! Highly recommended.
Cozy atmosphere and the Lamb Rogan Josh is a must-try dish here.
I love their vegetarian options. Dal Tadka was delightful.
The Pho Bo was absolutely delicious, full of flavor!
Loved the variety of noodles they offer. Dan Dan Noodles were spicy and tasty.
Udon was cooked perfectly. A great find for noodle lovers.
The Ribeye Steak was cooked to perfection. Highly recommend this place!
Great ambiance and top-notch service. The Porterhouse Steak is a must-try.
Decent steaks but a bit pricey. The Caesar Salad was fresh though.
The Lobster Roll is the best I've had! Fresh and full of flavor.
Loved the Seafood Linguine, and the service was excellent.
The Grilled Sea Bass was a delight. Will come back to try more dishes.
Every dish is a piece of art here, especially the Duck Confit. Simply sublime!
Had a wonderful dinner. The Coq au Vin was memorable.
Nice French cuisine, but the service was slower than expected. Ratatouille was good though.
Best pizza in town! The Meat Lover's Pizza is incredible.
Really enjoyed the Margherita Pizza. Fresh ingredients and a perfect crust.
Decent pizza but I expected more from the BBQ Chicken Pizza. Good service, though.
The Pork Dumplings are a must-try! So juicy and flavorful.
Loved the variety of dumplings, especially the Shrimp Dumplings. Great taste and nice atmosphere.
Really good vegetarian options like the Vegetable Dumplings. Fresh and delicious.
The Smoked Brisket melts in your mouth! Fantastic BBQ place.
Great BBQ Ribs and the side of Mac & Cheese was perfect. Definitely coming back.
Good food but service could be improved. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was tasty though.
The Pistachio Gelato is out of this world! So creamy and full of flavor.
Love the selection of gelato. Lemon Sorbet was refreshing and perfectly tart.
Really nice place to get authentic Italian gelato. Tiramisu flavor was a treat!
The Vegan Burger is the best I've had! Can't believe it's not meat.
Delicious and healthy! The Chickpea Curry had just the right amount of spice.
Great vegan options, and the Vegan Chocolate Cake is a must-try.
The Sushi Spot never disappoints. The Salmon Nigiri is my favorite.
Good variety and quality sushi. The Dragon Roll was fantastic!
Nice ambiance and quality food. Spicy Tuna Roll was delicious and had a great kick!
The croissants here are heavenly! Perfectly flaky and buttery.
Was excited to try the macarons but they were too sweet and a bit stale.
The apple pie had a good flavor, but the crust was not as crispy as I like.
The Doner Kebab is full of flavor and very satisfying.
The Lamb Shish Kebab was undercooked and chewy. Very disappointing.
Loved the Mixed Grill Platter. A great selection of meats and all cooked to perfection.
The Beef Carpaccio is a must-try! Delicious and well-prepared.
The service was slow, and the Mushroom Risotto was overly salty.
The ambiance is nice, but the Seafood Linguine was lackluster in flavor.
The Chicken Momo is incredible here! Full of spices and perfectly steamed.
Had high hopes for the Beef Momo but they were greasy and the meat was tough.
The Paneer Momo is a delightful vegetarian option, well-seasoned and fresh.
Spaghetti Carbonara had a rich and creamy sauce, just how I like it.
Penne Arrabbiata was overly spicy and unbalanced. Not what I expected.
Lasagna was okay, but lacked the depth of flavor I was hoping for.
The Eggs Benedict here are the best I've ever had! Perfectly poached eggs.
The Pancakes were disappointing, too dry and lacked flavor.
The French Toast is okay, but not as fluffy as I expected. Service was slow.
The Greek Salad is fresh and vibrant, perfect for a light lunch.
Very disappointed with the Cobb Salad, it was soggy and the dressing was bland.
Caprese Salad had fresh tomatoes, but not enough basil or balsamic. Could be better.
Loved the Beef Empanadas! They were juicy and well-seasoned.
The Cheese Empanadas were too greasy and lacked flavor.
The Chicken Empanadas are a great snack, tasty and filling.
The Espresso is strong and flavorful, just how I like it.
The Latte was lukewarm and the foam was not creamy at all. Very disappointed.
The Cappuccino is decent, but the atmosphere of the place doesn't feel cozy.
The Tonkotsu Ramen is amazing! Rich broth and tender pork.
Miso Ramen was too salty, and the noodles were overcooked.
Spicy Ramen has a good kick, but the broth lacked depth.
The Classic Tiramisu is to die for! Perfectly creamy and just the right amount of coffee flavor.
Was not impressed with the Mango Tiramisu; it was too sweet and lacked traditional flavors.
The Chocolate Tiramisu looked promising but was too dense and not as flavorful as expected.
The Raclette was a delightful experience, with perfectly melted cheese and a great selection of sides.
Extremely disappointed with the Gruyere Grilled Cheese, it was burnt and very greasy.
Loved the Classic Fondue! It was a hit with the entire family, and the dippers were fresh and tasty.
The Falafel Wrap is fantastic here—crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, with delicious sauces.
The Baba Ganoush was too smoky and had an overpowering garlic taste, not my favorite.
Hummus Plate was creamy and well-seasoned. Great appetizer for the table!
Chicken and Sausage Gumbo was a bowl of comfort—perfect spice, rich flavors.
Seafood Gumbo was okay; the seafood tasted fresh but the gumbo base lacked the depth I hoped for.
Jambalaya was dry and not at all what I expected. Very disappointing meal.
The Apple Pie is just like homemade—flaky crust and perfectly sweet filling.
Pecan Pie was too sweet for my taste, but my friend loved it.
Cherry Pie had a soggy crust and the cherries were not tart enough, quite bland overall.
